channel.title: setUndecorate boolean
channel.description:
I doubt i'll get an intelligent response, or one at all. Don't bother to reply please if you do not know the answer.
You know what setUndecorate does. if you don't basically it removes native decorations from the frame, mainly this is used to remove the title bar along with the buttons at the top of a standalone applet.
setUndecorate is best used when the frame is now being shown. The problem is, the client applets call the frame. I can use set unedecorate but i leaves the frame, just undecorated. Plain white space. This is problemative because its ugly and it makes the fullscreen not quite fullscreen.
Any ideas on how i can remove the actual frame or something along those lines? Ive attempted re-arranging the calling of show along with the calling of undecorate. Nothing works so far.
